venue.title: Venue & Date
venue.location: Bharat Mandapam, Pragati Maidan, New Delhi, India

social.title: Voices, Moments & Buzz: Straight from Socials
social.subtitle: WFI Social Media

sustainability.title: Sustainability and Net Zero Food Processing
points: India targets net-zero carbon emissions by 2070 through sustainable food processing.
Food processing is key to climate-resilient and resource-efficient systems.
Initiatives like PMKSY, Green Food Processing Fund, and PLI support green growth.
Industry adopts solar-dried units, biomass cold chains, and water-neutral plants.
Circular practices include food waste valorisation and sustainable packaging.
World Food India 2025 showcases innovations in low-carbon food value chains.

global.title: India as Global Food Processing Hub
points: India is a global leader in the production of milk, millets, pulses, fruits, and vegetables.
Second largest producer of fruits, vegetables, and cereals
Abundant raw materials make India ideal for food processing and value addition.
The sector benefits from supportive policies and 100% FDI via the automatic route.
Conducive schemes like Production linked incentive (PLI), Pradhan Mantri Kisan Sampada Yojana (PMKSY) promote expansion and competitiveness in food processing.
India offers unparalleled access to raw materials for value addition

innovation.title: Innovation in Food Processing and Packaging Technology
points: India is advancing smart food processing with technologies like high-pressure processing, cold plasma, and non-thermal pasteurisation.
Smart packaging with QR codes and blockchain ensures product traceability and boosts export transparency.
India's National Agri Stack aims to integrate food processing data to enable seamless backward-forward linkages
Active and intelligent packaging leading the development of bio-active packaging

nutrition.title: Processed food for Nutrition and Health
points: Fortiﬁed, functional, and clean-label nutrition formats
Embracing functional foods with added health benefits like gut health, immunity, and low-GI support
Transforming food processing into a driver of national nutrition and global health leadership
Food technology parks and startups focused on AI-assisted nutrition labelling, bio-fortiﬁcation tracking

livestock.title: Indian Livestock Products accelerating the Rural Economy
points: Livestock and marine sectors drive rural incomes and employment.
Government schemes support small-scale producers and enhance value addition.
Infrastructure development boosts market access and food processing.
Modern technologies improve efficiency in rural operations.
These sectors enhance nutrition and open global export opportunities.

keyHighlights.title: Key Highlights of World Food India 2024

partners.title: Partners 2025
partners.description: World Food India 2025 will bring together key partners, including central ministries, state governments, industry associations, leading corporates and international organizations. These partnerships are instrumental in shaping policy, driving innovation, and showcasing India's food processing potential. The collaboration ensures a unified platform to promote investment, technology, and sustainable growth in the sector.

wfi.title: WORLD FOOD INDIA
wfi.subtitle: World Food India 2025 is a gateway to the Indian food economy, facilitating partnerships between Indian and foreign investors.
wfi.description: World Food India serves as a premier gateway to India's thriving food economy, uniting key players across processing, packaging, logistics, and technology under one platform. It enables meaningful engagement, fosters investment opportunities, and drives innovation across the sector. The event showcases India's potential as a global hub for value-added food manufacturing and trade.

exhibitor.title: For Exhibitor
exhibitor.subtitle: FOR EXHIBITORS
exhibitor.content: Spread across 50,000 sq. m. of premium space at Pragati Maidan, World Food India 2023 brings together leading global and Indian companies from the food processing and allied sectors. With dedicated sectoral focus, international country pavilions, and state showcases highlighting products, agri-horti clusters, infrastructure, and policies, the exhibition offers a dynamic platform to explore business opportunities, forge global partnerships, and connect with key stakeholders to drive growth and investment.

investors.title: For Investors
investors.subtitle: FOR INVESTORS
investors.content: World Food India 2025 serves as a strategic platform for investors seeking to tap into one of the world's fastest-growing food economies. With India's vast agricultural base, rising consumer demand, and progressive policy support—including 100% FDI in food processing—investors can explore scalable opportunities across segments like processing, packaging, cold chain, logistics, and sustainable technologies. The event enables direct engagement with policymakers, state governments, and industry leaders, facilitating informed investment decisions and long-term partnerships.

buyers.title: For Buyers Sellers
buyers.subtitle: FOR BUYERS SELLERS
buyers.content: Connect with global buyers, sellers, and industry leaders at World Food India 2025. Explore new markets, discover innovative products and technologies, and build lasting partnerships through curated B2B meetings and networking opportunities. One platform. Endless opportunities.

showcase.title: To Showcase
showcase.subtitle: TO SHOWCASE
showcase.content: World Food India 2025 offers a powerful platform to showcase innovative solutions, strengthen market presence, and align with India's vision of becoming a global food processing hub. Exhibitors gain visibility, access emerging opportunities, and contribute to advancing sustainable, efficient, and technology-driven growth in the sector.

speakers.heading: Speakers of WFI 2025
speakers.subheading: Discover the visionaries driving transformative conversations in agri-tech, food processing, sustainability, investment, and beyond.

footer.downloadApp: Download the app by clicking the link below :

aboutWFI.paragraph1: Recognizing the transformative potential of the food processing sector in positioning India as a global food hub, the Ministry of Food Processing Industries (MoFPI), Government of India, has introduced a range of strategic initiatives to attract investment across diverse sub-segments. These efforts focus on strengthening farm-to-fork linkages, enhancing value addition, advancing research and development, expanding cold chain infrastructure, and supporting startups, logistics, and retail ecosystems—laying the foundation for a robust and future-ready food processing industry.
aboutWFI.paragraph2: To further promote India's rich and diverse food culture while fostering global investment, MoFPI launched World Food India (WFI)—a flagship international event. The first edition was held in 2017, followed by a successful second edition in 2023 and the third in 2024. WFI serves as a premier platform for stakeholders from across the world to connect, collaborate, and explore opportunities in India's dynamic food processing landscape. Building on the remarkable success of previous editions, 4th edition of this flagship event has been scheduled to take place from 25th to 28th September 2025 at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi.

title.line1: WORLD FOOD INDIA 2024 PAST EVENT SNAPSHOTS

rbsm.title: Reverse Buyer Seller Meet (RBSM)
rbsm.description: Experience the pinnacle of business networking at World Food India 2024 through the Reverse Buyer Seller Meet planned by the Ministry of Food Processing Industries (MoFPI). The RBSM will witness a seamless collaboration as all these Commodity boards converge for a combined effort to make the event a grand success. The meet will offer an array of advantages, including enhanced market access, interactions with potential partners, exposure to new products and innovations, insightful discussions on industry trends, and the creation of valuable B2B connections. This will be an exclusive opportunity to forge lasting business relationships and explore new horizons in the food industry.
